str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Probably a fuller form of rheo; an alternate for epo in certain tenses; to utter, i.e. Speak or say.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A head of a household. From oikos and despotes; the head of a family.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A teacher, master. From didasko; an instructor.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Genitive case of an interrogative pronoun pos otherwise obsolete; as adverb of place; at what locality.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An inn, lodging-place. From kataluo; properly, a dissolution, i.e. a lodging-place.
Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to eat.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The feast of Passover, the Passover lamb. Of Chaldee origin; the Passover.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
